label: A_hR1_166_a-001
title: $\beta$-Po ($A_i$) Structure
comments:
Originally, Po was assigned Strukturbericht designation \href{current_web_home_dir/A_mC12_5_3c-001}{$A19$}, which is now considered to be incorrect. (Donohue, 1982, 390) 
 This rhombohedral structure becomes cubic at various values of c/a (or $\alpha$) \begin{center} \begin{tabular}{ccc} $c/a$ & $\alpha$ & \textbf{Cubic} \textbf{Lattice} \\ \hline $\sqrt{7}$ & $60^{\circ}$ & \href{current_web_home_dir/A_cF4_225_a-001}{Face-Centered Cubic} \\ $\sqrt{\frac32}$ & $90^{\circ}$ & \href{current_web_home_dir/A_cP1_221_a-001}{Simple Cubic} \\ $\sqrt{\frac38}$ & $109.47^{\circ}$ & \href{current_web_home_dir/A_cI2_229_a-001}{Body-Centered Cubic} \\ \end{tabular} \end{center} ~ \vspace{-.25in} 
 Note that \href{current_web_home_dir/A_hR1_166_a-001}{$\beta$-Po (A\_hR1\_166\_a)} and \href{current_web_home_dir/A_hR1_166_a-002}{$\alpha$-Hg (A\_hR1\_166\_a)} have the same AFLOW prototype label. They are generated by the same symmetry operations with different sets of parameters ({\tt --params}) specified in their corresponding CIF files. Experimentally, $\beta$-Po ($A_{i}$) has c/a near 1, or $\alpha > 90^{\circ}$, while $\alpha$-Hg (A10) has c/a near 2, or $\alpha < 90^{\circ}$. 
 Hexagonal settings of rhombohedral structures can be obtained with the option {\tt --hex}.
